raw_text: DIGITAL PRODUCER       Summary     Personable  Project Manager  successful at building strong professional relationships. Manages large and complex projects while maintaining high team morale and energy. Skilled mentor and mediator who excels at bringing out the best in team members.        Highlights          Budgeting and forecasting  Process improvement  Contract management  Relationship building  Microsoft Office Suite expert  Project development and lifecycle  Superb time management skills  Detail-oriented      Sound judgment  Organized and efficient  Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite  Decisive problem solver  Exceptional multi-tasker  Deadline-driven  Special events planning            Experience     08/2015   to   Current     Digital Producer    Company Name   －   City  ,   State       Managed a project budget of $300,000.      Drafted action plans and led meetings with internal teams and clients to review project status and proposed changes.         Monitored team progress and enforced deadlines for up to four projects at once.       Defined project deliverables and monitored status of tasks.            10/2014   to   08/2015     Producer    Company Name   －   City  ,   State      Managed all event logistics from conception to completion  Ensured program objectives and strategies are met and all events are produced to the      highest quality  Maintained and expanded vendor relationships and negotiated contracts, pricing and services  Collaborated with agency departments in all project stages to develop creative solutions to meet clients' needs  Managed budgets with integrity and transparency at all times         02/2013   to   10/2014     Associate Producer    Company Name   －   City  ,   State      Managed and executed smaller scale events with 2-3 staff.  Served as a liaison between vendors, staff and clients regarding event details.  Provided production support on-site during events.  Anticipated project needs to meet deadlines.         09/2011   to   02/2013     Production Coordinator    Company Name   －   City  ,   State      Researched and gathered information in planning phase for the execution of events.  Coordinated and attended site visits.  Tracked invoices and created check requests.         06/2011   to   09/2011     Production Intern    Company Name   －   City  ,   State            Education     May 2011     Bachelor of Science  :   Business Administration and Computer Information Systems    Lewis University   －   City  ,   State      Business Administration and Computer Information Systems        Skills        Project Management Tools: Workamajig, Basecamp, DoneDone  Desktop Publishing Software: Photoshop, Illustrator, HTML
story:
Here's their career story:

Starting as a fresh graduate from Lewis University in 2011 with a degree in Business Administration and Computer Information Systems, this professional began their journey as a Production Intern at their first company. Even as an intern, their potential was quickly recognized, leading to a promotion to Production Coordinator within the same year. In this role, they cut their teeth on event planning fundamentals, handling everything from site visits to invoice tracking.

By early 2013, they had advanced to Associate Producer, where they began managing small-scale events with their own staff. This experience proved invaluable as they learned to juggle vendor relationships and on-site production support. Their growing expertise led to a Producer position in late 2014, where they took on full responsibility for event logistics and budget management, while building strong relationships with vendors and internal teams.

The pinnacle of their career transformation came in August 2015 when they became a Digital Producer, a position they continue to hold. In this role, they've successfully managed multiple concurrent projects with budgets up to $300,000, while leading teams and maintaining client relationships. Their technical prowess with tools like Workamajig, Basecamp, and Adobe Creative Suite, combined with their natural talent for project management and team leadership, has made them a valuable asset in the digital production space.

Throughout their career progression, they've consistently demonstrated strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and an ability to meet deadlines while managing multiple projects. Their journey from intern to Digital Producer showcases their growth from handling basic coordination tasks to managing complex, high-stakes digital projects while maintaining team morale and delivering exceptional results.
